item.title: How do I make this a pickup server?
item.dc:creator: @Liquid_Magic Liquid Magic
item.description:
@Liquid_Magic wrote:

// Command pickup
		if (command.startsWith("pickup") && (playerRights >= 2)) {
		String[] args = command.split(" ");
	    if (args.length == 3) {
		int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]);
		int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]);
		if ((newItemID <= 20000) && (newItemID >= 0)) {
		addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount);
		sendMessage("You picked up " + newItemID + " " + newItemAmount + " time(s).");
		} else {
		sendMessage("No item available of that ID");
		}
		} else {
		sendMessage("Please try ::pickup 0995 999999999");
		}
		} else if (command.startsWith("pickup") && (playerRights < 2)) {
		sendMessage("You cannot use this command.");
		}

Put that in client.java inbetween

public void customCommand(String command) {

Works, unless your directories are in certain folders like “Bin” or “Src”.

Try making it.

item.title: How do I make this a pickup server?
item.dc:creator: @Project_Evolution Project Evolution
item.description:
@Project_Evolution wrote:

This should be what the command looks like,

[code=java]if (playerCommand.startsWith(“item”) && c.playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“YOURNAMEHERE”)) {
try {
String[] args = playerCommand.split(" ");
if (args.length == 3) {
int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]);
int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]);
if ((newItemID <= 20000) && (newItemID >= 0)) {
c.getItems().addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount);
} else {
c.sendMessage(“No such item.”);
}
} else {
c.sendMessage(“Use as ::pickup 995 200”);
}
} catch(Exception e) {

}
}[/code]

Sorry, I lost all the formatting.

Read full topic

item.title: How do I make this a pickup server?
item.dc:creator: @WiseMen WiseMen
item.description:
@WiseMen wrote:

Thanks kind of, I get 2 errors? ;l

I removed all the /* and */'s because those are Anti-Leech protection if I am correct?

EDIT; I have ::item working, thanks. But I still have 2 errors

Read full topic
item.source: How do I make this a pickup server?

item.title: How do I make this a pickup server?
item.dc:creator: @Project_Evolution Project Evolution
item.description:
@Project_Evolution wrote:

WiseMen, the problem lays with the little /* and */ symbols. Those are basically the same as // but are for multiple lines. The // symbols represent a comment line, when this happens, the compiler ignores anything on the line with a beginning //.

So basically the command was completely ignored by the compiler. The simple fix is to remove the /* and */.

Also,

c.playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("sanity"))

Dont forget to replace sanity with your character’s name.

Read full topic

item.title: How do I make this a pickup server?
item.dc:creator: @WiseMen WiseMen
item.description:
@WiseMen wrote:

Well I downloaded Project Insanity, and I tried to code it a little and I figured it wasn’t a pickup server but it has this

/*if (playerCommand.startsWith("item") && c.playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("sanity")) { try { String[] args = playerCommand.split(" "); if (args.length == 3) { int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]); int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]); if ((newItemID <= 20000) && (newItemID >= 0)) { c.getItems().addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount); } else { c.sendMessage("No such item."); } } else { c.sendMessage("Use as ::pickup 995 200");

I changed sanity to “WiseMen” and it still didn’t work. I tried using ::pickup and ::item still doesn’t work.
